The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York has announced that it is planning to open a new exhibition in the former Kodak building in the city’s Chelsea neighborhood in September 2021. In a release, MoMA said it will create a new platform for artists and curators to create new exhibitions and feature works. “The exhibition is a continuation of MoMA’s ongoing strategy to experiment with new materials and new materials combinations to create works that answer the questions of what happens when we are not here, and what happens when we are not in a way we can’t control,” said MoMA director Marc Glimcher. The new program will draw from a selection of work that is currently on display in the museum, which has been closed since December 2019 due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
